pullRequest.title: HDDS-2184. Rename ozone scmcli to ozone admin
pullRequest.bodyText:
What changes were proposed in this pull request?
Originally ozone scmcli designed to be used only by the developers. A very cryptic name is chosen intentionally to frighten away the beginner users.
As we realized recently we started to use ozone scmcli as a generic admin tool. More and more tools has been added which are useful not only for the developers but for the administrators.
Therefore I suggest to rename ozone scmcli to something more meaningful.
For example to ozone admin
This idea has already been discussed during a community meeting but was not implemented.
What is the link to the Apache JIRA
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDDS-2184
How was this patch tested?
Manually with a docker-compose based cluster and with acceptance tests.

commit.message: HDDS-2184. Rename ozone scmcli to ozone admin

nodes.bodyText: Since you renamed scmcli to admin, I feel that OzoneAdmin or Admin would be a more appropriate name for the interface. Thoughts?

nodes.bodyText: Could you please add a doc page for the new command?
I think this belongs more to ContainerCommands, rather than one of the container-specific subcommands.

Previously this printed the full command:
$ ozone scmcli safemode
Incomplete command
Usage: ozone scmcli safemode [-hV] [COMMAND]
...

Now it is only (note the "incomplete" command following Usage:):
$ ozone admin safemode
Incomplete command
Usage: safemode [-hV] [COMMAND]
...

I think the first one is more helpful.
